justification: Correctly notes B’s QB surplus, but ignores B’s injury caution and affinity for dual-threat QBs—trading away a Tier 1 dual-threat for a Tier 4 QB and a questionable WR is misaligned. B already has a rookie deep-threat (Ben Martin), so the stated WR ‘need’ is weak. Value is lopsided; A already rosters a Tier 1 QB, reducing A’s urgency. The acceptance probability is overstated.
